ayatollah

noun

Islam
  1. A high-ranking Shiite religious authority regarded as worthy of imitation in matters of religious law and interpretation.
  2. Used as a title for such a leader.

Origin of ayatollah

Persian āyatollāh from Arabic 'āyatu llāh sign of God 'āyatu bound form of 'āya sign, Koranic verse &aleph;wy allāh Allah ; see Allah .

(plural ayatollahs)

  1. A religious leader in Twelver Shi'ism; a member of the ’ulama.

Borrowing from Persian آیت‌الله (âyatollâh), from Arabic آية الله ('āyatu-llāh, “sign of God”)
